snippet: The meeting came amid speculation of a possible multibillion-dollar gas pipeline deal by Athens and Moscow, which could provide Greece needed money.
abstract: Greek officials, facing desperate cash shortage, meet with Aleksei B Miller, head of Russian energy giant Gazprom, in what many speculate could be potential multibillion-dollar pipeline deal between countries; meeting comes as Greece tries to negotiate new debt agreement with European creditors, and as European Union considers antitrust charges against Gazprom.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Stanley Reed from London, Andrew Roth from Moscow, Sebnem Arsu from Istanbul and James Kanter from Brussels.

lead_paragraph: The meeting came amid speculation of a possible multibillion-dollar gas pipeline deal by Athens and Moscow, which could provide Greece needed money.

headline.main: As Cash Dwindles, Greece Negotiates With Gazprom on ‘Energy Cooperation’
headline.print_headline: As Cash Dwindles, Greece Negotiates With Gazprom on ‘Energy Cooperation’
